citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
At time of inspection a Moluccan Cockatoo was observed to have a significantly overgrown beak. The licensee advised
that the bird was surrendered but had suffered an injury to the right side of the face and lower beak 8-10 years prior to
acquisition. The licensee stated that the bird did need a beak trim but had not contacted a veterinarian to do such.
Malformation and overgrown beaks can cause significant health issues such as the ability to consume food stuffs
adequately or even grooming. The licensee shall have the Cockatoo seen by a licensed veterinarian for beak
management.
To be corrected by 6.25.25

citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
At time of inspection an Artic Fox was observed having overgrown nails. Overgrown nails can cause discomfort or
ambulatory issues if left unattended. A proactive grooming regimen to include nail maintenance should be discussed with
the attending veterinarian and implemented. Daily observation of all animals to assess their health and well-being is vital
to animal husbandry.
To be corrected by 6.30.25

At time of inspection a Fruit Bat was observed housed in a 4 square foot shadow box. With such limited room, the bat is
not able to perform the natural posture of flying. As a larger species of bat, the Fruit Bat has a large wing span which
needs sufficient room to perform natural behaviors. Additional space is to be provided to the bat so as to promote the
health and wellbeing.
To be corrected by 6.30.25

At time of inspection the hedgehog enclosure was covered in flies. Flies can cause irritation and undesired animal health
issues. A proactive pest control regimen should be discussed with the attending veterinarian and implemented for the
control of flies.
To be corrected by 6.30.25
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Facility Representative.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
At time of inspection a Moluccan Cockatoo was observed to have a significantly overgrown beak. The licensee advised 
that the bird was surrendered but had suffered an injury to the right side of the face and lower beak 8-10 years prior to 
acquisition. The licensee stated that the bird did need a beak trim but had not contacted a veterinarian to do such.  
Malformation and overgrown beaks can cause significant health issues such as the ability to consume food stuffs 
adequately or even grooming. The licensee shall have the Cockatoo seen by a licensed veterinarian for beak 
management.  
 
 
To be corrected by 6.25.25 
2.40(b)(3) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
At time of inspection an Artic Fox was observed having overgrown nails. Overgrown nails can cause discomfort or 
ambulatory issues if left unattended. A proactive grooming regimen to include nail maintenance should be discussed with 
the attending veterinarian and implemented. Daily observation of all animals to assess their health and well-being is vital 
to animal husbandry.  
 
To be corrected by 6.30.25 
3.128 
   
Space requirements. 
At time of inspection a Fruit Bat was observed housed in a 4 square foot shadow box. With such limited room, the bat is 
not able to perform the natural posture of flying. As a larger species of bat, the Fruit Bat has a large wing span which 
needs sufficient room to perform natural behaviors. Additional space is to be provided to the bat so as to promote the 
health and wellbeing. 
 
To be corrected by 6.30.25

3.131(d) 
   
Sanitation. 
At time of inspection the hedgehog enclosure was covered in flies. Flies can cause irritation and undesired animal health 
issues. A proactive pest control regimen should be discussed with the attending veterinarian and implemented for the 
control of flies. 
 
To be corrected by 6.30.25 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Facility Representative.
